intro: Crepis heterotricha, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, with a distinctive silvery underside, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Crepis heterotricha is often found in disturbed habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
